com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec

Interface AckMsg

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Msg, XMLDecoder

    public interface AckMsg
extends Msg
    UPA acknowledgment message is sent from a provider to a consumer to indicate receipt of a specific message. The acknowledgment carries success or failure (negative acknowledgment or Nak) information to the consumer. Currently, a consumer can request acknowledgment for a PostMsg or a CloseMsg.
    See Also:
    Msg, CloseMsg, PostMsg, AckMsgFlags, NakCodes

        the nakCode
        See Also:
        NakCodes

      • seqNum

        void seqNum(long seqNum)
        A user-defined sequence number.

        To help with temporal ordering, seqNum should increase, though gaps might exist depending on the sequencing algorithm in use. The acknowledgment message may populate this with the seqNum of the PostMsg being acknowledged. This helps correlate the message being acknowledged when the postId alone is not sufficient (e.g., multi-part post messages). Must be in the range of 0 - 4294967296 (2^32).

        Parameters:
        seqNum - the seqNum to set

      • seqNum

        long seqNum()
        A user-defined sequence number.

        To help with temporal ordering, seqNum should increase, though gaps might exist depending on the sequencing algorithm in use. The acknowledgment message may populate this with the seqNum of the PostMsg being acknowledged. This helps correlate the message being acknowledged when the postId alone is not sufficient (e.g., multi-part post messages).

        Returns:
        the seqNum
